page.title: 14LOCAL SCHOOLS (CONTINUED)
page.content: {RUSKIN JUNIOR }school was built in 1969. There are about 200 children in the school. The number of pupils has varied from 200-400, during the time that the school has existed. The best feature of the school is a big playing field. The school is good at swimming. Most of the children transfer to Weavers Comprehensive School at 11+. The school was built to accomodate the children of families moving onto the Queensway estate from London. {HARDWICK JUNIOR}school was in use in 1969. There are 313 children on roll at present. The best features of the school are the computer and the swimming pool. When the children leave the school they mainly go to Weavers. {HARDWICK INFANTS}school was completed by 1975. The school has 225 children ranging in age from 5 to 7 years. At present, the numbers are dropping.
